content.description: Start high. Short climb up the face
content.location: To the right of the arete on the north side face of the boulder

content.description: Climb right of the arete on an undercling lieback.  Start high.

On the left side of the overhang, there is a obvious slanting rail.  Start on the ground, and find the best foothold.  Work your hands up the slanting rail until you reach the top of it.  Make a big reach up to one of the holds at the top of the boulder.  Match and mantle.

A great problem on a classic boulder.  Enjoy!
content.location: The sloth boulder is the large boulder next to Swan Slab, just south of the footpath.

content.description:
A seldom climbed problem on a classic, high profile boulder.

Begin sitting down under the far right side of the prominent overhanging eastern side of the boulder.  Find a good edge for your left hand, and palm the arete with your right hand.  Lift yourself up and bump your right hand to a hidden hold that is a rounded and white (crux).  Follow the arete up and left.  Top out directly above the start, on the left side of the arete.
content.location:
On the right side of the overhang.

The Sloth Boulder is located next to Swan Slab, just south of the foot path.

content.description:
This one is up there with the best V0 traverses in the park.

There are many variations to this classic traverse, but the most commonly used is the traverse from left to right.

Start up high and move right on great holds across an overhanging face.  Shuffle your feet along the slanting rail, or use heal hooks as you traverse right.  Crux move is in the middle of the traverse where a long reach to the right leaves your feet without foot holds.  Continue traversing right until you reach the end of the overhang.  Heal hook, and mantle to finish.
content.protection: A crash pad is not required.
content.location: On the boulder just to the south of the trail next to Swan Slab.
